page.title: 10Youth Custody Centre
page.content: In the south-east corner of Wellingborough is a Youth Custody Centre. Formerly called the Borstal the Centre caters for boys from sixteen to about twenty-two. Boys are sent to the entre for commiting crimes like A.B.H. and criminal damage for periods of four months to four years. At the moment there are 360 boys in there with about 60 staff on duty at any one time. The boys' day is a mixture of education classes and a period of relaxation called Association. The centre has six self-contained wings,a central kitchen, a laundry, a hospital and a secure area for boys who have misbehaved. Outside the buildings there are further workshops, a garden, small farm and some outside sports areas. The boys can earn a wage of about two pounds a week.
